original_title: Angry Robot Face Is Less Than Friendly
original_content:
Sometimes you just need to create a creepy robot head and give it an intimidating personality. [Jens] has done just that, and ably so, with his latest eerie creation.
The robot face is introduced to us with a soundtrack befitting Stranger Things, or maybe Luke Million. The build was inspired by The Doorman, a creepy art piece with animatronic eyes. [Jens] build started with a 3D model of a 3D mask, with the eyes and mouth modified to have rectangular cutouts for LED displays. The displays are run by a Raspberry Pi Pico, which generates a variety of eye and mouth animations. It uses a camera for face tracking, so the robots evil eyes seem to follow the viewer as they move around. In good form, the face has a simple switch—from good to evil, happy to angry. Or, as [Jens] designates the modes: Fren and Not Fren.
[Jens] does a great job explaining the build, and his acting at the end of the video is absolutely worth a chuckle. Given Halloween is around the corner, why not build five to eight of these, and hide them in your roommates bedroom?
Video after the break.
title: クリーピーロボットヘッドを作成！Raspberry Pi PicoとLEDディスプレイで表情豊かな顔を実現
body: 「恐ろしいロボットの頭と迫力のある性格を作ることがたまにある。それを[Jens]は恐ろしいアート作品「The Doorman」に触発されて行った。Raspberry Pi Picoを使用し、カメラで顔検知を行う。ハロウィンが近づいているので、ルームメイトのベッドルームに5〜8個隠すのはいかが？」
